page.title: 18ST.MATTHEW'S HOSPITAL.2.
page.content: C.A.Jones. The Work of the Hospital. St.Matthew's Hospital in Burntwood was built and opened by the County of Stafford in 1864 for mentally ill patients. When it was opened it could take up to 1000 patients.There were very large wards where many people would be crammed together.Those patients who were violent or may harm themselves were locked up in padded cells.The longest time that a patient has stayed in the hospital is 60 years.She was not ill,she was put in the hospital for being bad as a child. The wards are now divided into cubicles for privacy.Many patients go to the hospital on a day basis for treatment of different kinds.The patients who do not go out are suffering from Senile Dementia.
